CatDescriptText: Erma Cofer, elevator operator, 6922 Hamilton Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 23, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that there will be a steel strike?  Do you think steelworkers are entitled to the raise which they requested or do you think wages should be frozen, according to the argument of the steel industry management?" answer reads: "I don't think that there will be a strick.  I think that the majority of the steelmill [sic] workers want to work at the same wage because every time there is a raise, things go up, and it is bad for the poor people."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Erma Cofer wearing earrings, necklace, dark dress with embroidered floral overlay, and light colored coat, standing in front of Sherwin Williams store window with paint displays, possibly on Smithfield Street, Downtown
